tafsirQuiz.question: According to the tafsir, what should we understand from this verse?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The setting of the stars is a symbol which hints at the stable and flawless system governing the revolution of stars. This is an indication that the spiritual system established with the help of revelation and prophethood should also be flawless
distractors: This verse focuses on scientific facts
This verse only discusses worldly matters
This verse addresses only legal rulings

tafsirQuiz.question: What insight does the explanation provide about this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The experience of the Prophet with the angels and his being taught the revelation have been explained in the above verses. For corroborating the reality of these events the statement of the Quran is enough
distractors: This verse is primarily about historical events
This verse only discusses worldly matters
This verse focuses on scientific facts

tafsirQuiz.question: What is the central theme of this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: These three, according to the popular belief of those days, were the daughters of god, and so they were worshipped. A belief of this kind was undoubtedly a baseless supposition
distractors: This verse is about the battles of early Muslims
This verse talks about the Day of Judgment only

tafsirQuiz.question: What is the main message of Surah An-Najm, Ayah 21?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: ’ Shah Abdul Qadir Dehlavi writes, ‘What does one get by worshipping deities. Explaining the query in verse 24, ‘Does man get all that he wants
distractors: This verse talks about the Day of Judgment only
This verse is about the battles of early Muslims

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah An-Najm, Ayah 25?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Making deities of stone and worshipping them, calling the angels ‘daughters of God,’ hoping to enter Paradise on the basis of recommendations—all these are non-serious beliefs
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse explains the rules of inheritance

tafsirQuiz.question: Which important teaching is conveyed in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: So, they are not ready to accept the word of Truth. However, Almighty God knows the inner condition of everybody and according to that He will deal with each one
distractors: This verse gives rulings on trade and commerce
This verse narrates a historical event
This verse warns about the punishment of disbelievers

tafsirQuiz.question: According to the tafsir, what should we understand from this verse?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The universe with its extremely stable system makes manifest the fact that its Creator and Lord is extremely powerful. This suffices to make it clear that He will sooner or later seize hold of man and when He does so, there will be no escaping His grasp
distractors: This verse addresses only legal rulings
This verse focuses on scientific facts
This verse only discusses worldly matters

tafsirQuiz.question: What key concept does this verse highlight?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Almighty God has given full guidance to man as to what he should do and what he should not. So, it is not required that he be as pure as the angels
distractors: This verse narrates a historical event
This verse promises paradise to the righteous
This verse warns about the punishment of disbelievers

tafsirQuiz.question: Which important teaching is conveyed in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: There are many who become inclined towards the Truth, but only to a certain extent. In order to justify and explain their wrong behaviour, such people devise different types of engaging ‘beliefs’
distractors: This verse narrates a historical event
This verse promises paradise to the righteous
This verse warns about the punishment of disbelievers

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: There is nobody more foolish in this world of God than those who are not affected by this prophetic warning. The sum and substance of the reality revealed by Almighty God through His prophets is that every man has to receive the reward befitting his deeds
distractors: This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah An-Najm, Ayah 43?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Every event in this world arises from supernatural causes and nobody but God is capable of causing them to occur. Happiness and sorrow, life and death, the pro-creative system, riches and poverty—all these are the feats of a superpower
distractors: This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: What is the central theme of this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Thereafter, certain factors come into play and that nation is destroyed or faces decline and fades into oblivion. It is apparently impossible for it to be overpowered
distractors: This verse talks about the Day of Judgment only
This verse describes the creation of mankind

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The history of the prophets as related in the Quran shows that the denial of Truth and its fatal result are as close to each other as two fingers of the same hand
